statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: McNeese St. 61, Central Arkansas 56 OT
article.story: LAKE CHARLES, La. (AP) -- McNeese State trailed most of the way but made up for it at the end, outscoring Central Arkansas 11-4 in the last 3:17 to tie the game, then making four of five field goals in overtime to win 61-56. The Cowboys (7-12, 2-3 Southland) have gone into overtime in three of their last four games. Central Arkansas (6-13, 1-5) led by as many as eight points on the way to a 25-21 halftime advantage. In the second half, they led from 11:40 on until John Ford hit a 3-point shot with less than 30 seconds left to put the Cowboys up 49-47. Central Arkansas' Nate Bowie hit a layup with 13 seconds left to put the game into overtime at 49-49. The Cowboys got the first eight points in overtime. Ford, who finished with 16 points, and John Pichon, who had 11, each had four points in overtime. Quentin Gonzales had 11 points and 11 rebounds, and Jarvis Bradley had 10 points. Fernando Johnson had 13 points for Central Arkansas, and Durrell Nevels and Nate Bowie had 11 each.
